tier.item: In Thai, the noun is always preceding the numeral and the classifier
possessives, and relative clauses must follow the noun, as shown in (13),
Diacritics are omitted in the Vietnamese examples, for typographical reasons.
The data collected by Agbayani (1995) indicate that relative clauses should
follow demonstratives, contrary to Clark (1978) and Nguyen (1997). In this
paper I do not have any explanation of such a discrepancy.
